chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
items.plainText: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

items.text: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.
items.plainText: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

items.text: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.
items.plainText: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

items.text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.
items.plainText: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

items.text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
items.plainText: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

items.text: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.
items.plainText: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

items.text: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.
items.plainText: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

items.text: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.
items.plainText: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

items.text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
items.plainText: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

items.text: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.
items.plainText: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

items.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.
items.plainText: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

items.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.
items.plainText: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

items.text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
items.plainText: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

items.text: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.
items.plainText: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

items.text: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
items.plainText: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

items.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.
items.plainText: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

items.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.
items.plainText: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

items.text: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:
items.plainText: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:

items.text: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
items.plainText: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

items.text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.
items.plainText: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

items.text: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
items.plainText: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

items.text: It is of the LORD's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
items.plainText: It is of the LORD's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

items.text: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.
items.plainText: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

items.text: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
items.plainText: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

items.text: The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
items.plainText: The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

items.text: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.
items.plainText: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.

items.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
items.plainText: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

items.text: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
items.plainText: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

items.text: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
items.plainText: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

items.text: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
items.plainText: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

items.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:
items.plainText: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

items.text: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
items.plainText: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

items.text: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
items.plainText: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

items.text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,
items.plainText: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

items.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
items.plainText: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

items.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
items.plainText: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

items.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
items.plainText: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

items.text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
items.plainText: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

items.text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
items.plainText: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

items.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.
items.plainText: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.

items.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
items.plainText: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

items.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
items.plainText: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

items.text: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
items.plainText: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

items.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
items.plainText: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

items.text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
items.plainText: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

items.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
items.plainText: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

items.text: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
items.plainText: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

items.text: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
items.plainText: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

items.text: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
items.plainText: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

items.text: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.
items.plainText: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.

items.text: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
items.plainText: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

items.text: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
items.plainText: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

items.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
items.plainText: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

items.text: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.
items.plainText: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

items.text: I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.
items.plainText: I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.

items.text: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
items.plainText: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

items.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
items.plainText: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

items.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
items.plainText: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

items.text: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.
items.plainText: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

items.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
items.plainText: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

items.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;
items.plainText: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;

items.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
items.plainText: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

items.text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.
items.plainText: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

items.text: Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.
items.plainText: Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

items.text: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
items.plainText: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

items.text: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
items.plainText: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
